text: Abdus Salim Khan, also known as Khan Sahib (28 December 1907 â€“ 12/13 July 1957) was an early Pakistani diplomat.Pakistan Foreign Office Records, 1947-1977, Sr No He served as Pakistan's ambassador in Ceylon (now called Sri Lanka) and Japan.FO Records He also served as Consul-General in the United States, posted at New York and later as Pakistan's Deputy High Commissioner (a type of special ambassador) to the United Kingdom.Obituary Notice, 1957 Khan died sudddenly in July 1957, while on duty in London, United Kingdom.Obituary Notice He was the son of Khan-sahib Abdul Majid Khan Tarin, OBE, and husband of Begum Mahmooda Salim Khan. ==References== Category:Pakistani diplomats Category:1907 births Category:1957 deaths Category:Ambassadors to Japan
